definition: To provide with a place to live or to be stored in.
A system of government in which most of the important decisions are made by state officials rather than by elected representatives.
Wishing to do one's work or duty well and thoroughly.
Without doubt (used for emphasis).
Make (someone) feel very happy, animated, or elated.
Of, from, in, or characteristic of a country or language other than one's own.
An instrument or device for measuring the magnitude, amount, or contents of something.
A system or organization in which people or groups are ranked one above the other according to status or authority.
Absolutely necessary.
Intelligent and well informed.
Communication or cooperation which facilitates a close working relationship between people or organizations.
A period of a thousand years, especially when calculated from the traditional date of the birth of Christ.
Required to be done, achieved, or present; needed; essential.
At infrequent or irregular intervals; now and then.
The way in which a word is pronounced.
A set of printed or written questions with a choice of answers, devised for the purposes of a survey or statistical study.
A strong, regular, repeated pattern of movement or sound.
A plan for carrying out a process or procedure, giving lists of intended events and times.
The magnitude or intensity that must be exceeded for a certain reaction, phenomenon, result, or condition to occur or be manifested.
(of two or more people) fully in agreement.
A space entirely devoid of matter.
Suggesting something supernatural; uncanny.
A musical instrument played by striking a row of wooden bars of graduated length with one or more small wooden or plastic beaters.
A medium-sized sailboat equipped for cruising or racing.
Consisting of a mixture of various things that are not usually connected with each other.
